communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A complete and current roster of all former and current employees of the Mobile Crisis Team (MCT), including for each employee:

Full name
Age
Gender
Race
Job title
Department or division
Work email address (if available)
Date of hire (if available and non-exempt)
Date of termination (if relevant)

If any of the above fields are exempt from disclosure, please redact only the exempt information and release the remainder of the records in accordance with the partial disclosure provisions of applicable public records law. I am not requesting any personally identifiable information that is protected by law, such as Social Security numbers or personal contact information.

I would prefer to receive this information in electronic format (e.g., CSV, Excel, or PDF) if available.

If there are any fees for searching or copying the records, please inform me before processing the request. I also request a waiver of fees as the information is being sought for research and public interest purposes, not for commercial use.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Filed Requests

title: Title IX Sexual Miscondut Non-Email Records 2010 - 2014

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Title IX Sexual Miscondut Non-Email Records 2010 - 2014
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All non-email records made between 2017 and 2020 which include the term "Title IX" within reference to the Education Amendments of 1972, specifically as they refer to its sexual harassment policy (excluding issues pertaining to transgender athletes).

I require this data for academic research purposes, in association with the University of Maryland - College Park. The study aims to understand the recent history of the development of Title IX of the Education Amendments of 1972, from 2010 to now.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sarah Silberman

title: Irvine, California raid over ICE fliers (Department of Homeland Security)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

This request concerns actions taken on May 1, 2025, in Irvine, California, as referenced in these articles: (a) https://www.foxnews.com/us/california-home-suspect-accused-doxing-ice-agents-raided-searched; and (b) https://abc7.com/post/ice-agents-storm-michael-changs-parents-irvine-home-search-answers-posters-placed-around-la/16298909. These actions concern the search warrant executed on May 1, 2025, in or near Irvine, California (the "Search Warrant") and the fliers depicting the names, photos, phone numbers, and/or locations of ICE officers (the "ICE Fliers"). An example of the ICE Fliers can be found at https://a57.foxnews.com/static.foxnews.com/foxnews.com/content/uploads/2025/02/1440/810/socal-flyers-exposing-personal-information-of-ice-agents.png?ve=1&tl=1. 

I request:

(1) Any Communications sent to or from your press, media, or public relations personnel relating to (a) the Search Warrant or (b) the ICE Fliers. This request is limited to records generated on or after January 20, 2025.

(2) Any Communications sent or received by Tricia McLaughlin concerning (a) the Search Warrant or (b) the ICE Fliers.

(3) Any Communications sent or received by Todd Lyons concerning (a) the Search Warrant or (b) the ICE Fliers.

(4) Any Communications between your press, media, or public relations personnel, on the one hand, and Bill Melugin, on the other hand, on or after January 20, 2025.

(5) A copy of any video or photographs shared with any journalist or media outlet (a) depicting the ICE Fliers or (b) taken in connection with preparations for or execution of the Search Warrant.

(6) A copy of any ICE Fliers (or any photographs of ICE Fliers) that were the subject of the Search Warrant.

(7) All after-action reports or incident reports summarizing the execution of the Search Warrant.

(8) A copy of the Search Warrant.

(9) A copy of any application for the Search Warrant.

"Communications" means and includes emails, text messages, social media messages, letters, memoranda, calendar entries, chats, or any form of one-to-one or one-to-many communication.

Please note that this request seeks public records wherever they may be found, including on devices or networks owned or operated by private parties. For example, if an employee uses a personal cell phone or social media account to conduct public business, records created, maintained, or held on the phone or account are public records subject to this request.

REQUEST FOR EXPEDITED PROCESSING:

I request that this request be expedited under 6 CFR § 5.5(e)(1)(ii) and (iv) for the following reasons:

1. I certify the following to be true and correct: My organization is primarily engaged in disseminating information. The Foundation for Individual Rights and Expression (FIRE) maintains a news website at https://thefire.org/news, through which its staff members regularly publish news stories and editorial content concerning the activities of governments, government officials, and other persons or organizations of public concern. I am a staff member of FIRE. I frequently write about matters involving the First Amendment and free expression, including on FIRE's website. See, e.g., https://www.thefire.org/news-archive?author=303. A substantial component of my duties as a staff member of FIRE is to obtain information through public records requests, including through the Freedom of Information Act, which I or my colleagues then share through FIRE's website and social media channels. I also publish news and other information of public concern via "X" (https://x.com/adamsteinbaugh) and "Bluesky" (https://bsky.app/profile/adamsteinbaugh.bsky.social).

I have previously been granted expedited processing by federal agencies, including the Department of Defense.

2. The requested information concerns an actual or alleged government activity, namely the agency's involvement in the execution of a search warrant.

3. The requested information extends beyond the public's right to know about government activity generally and instead has a particular value that would be lost if not processed on an expedited basis. The information pertains to a news story of public interest. That issue has attracted a wide range of news media coverage, including the articles identified above, which are helpful in establishing that there is an urgency to inform the public on this topic. Additionally, the federal government has established that there is a public interest in the execution of this search warrant because it invited a journalist to cover its execution, as reflected by a tweet posted by FOX News journalist Bill Melugin (https://x.com/BillMelugin_/status/1918036686631739469). 

4. The records concern a matter of widespread and exceptional media interest in which there exist possible questions about the government's integrity which affect public confidence. The records relate to a search warrant reportedly predicated on a political activist's publication of information identifying law enforcement officers. That conduct implicates the First Amendment's broad protection for the publication of information concerning government officials and conduct. The federal government recognizes that there is widespread and exceptional media interest in the underlying subject matter because it invited at least one journalist from a national media outlet to cover the execution of the search warrant. 

REQUEST FOR A FEE WAIVER OR REDUCED FEES:

I request, under 6 CFR § 5.11(k), a waiver or reduction of fees for the following reasons:

1. Disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest because its disclosure would shed light on the operations or activities of the government. The requested information pertains specifically to controversial conduct by law enforcement personnel.

2. Disclosure of the requested information would be likely to contribute significantly to public understanding of those operations or activities. Disclosure of the requested information would meaningfully inform the public about the government's activities and operations.

3. Disclosure of the requested information will contribute to the understanding of a reasonably broad audience of persons interested in the subject, as opposed to the individual understanding of the requester. The requestor is a licensed attorney who practices First Amendment law. As such, the requestor will be able to effectively convey information to the public. Further, the requestor is a representative of the news media. The requestor and his employer, the Foundation for Individual Rights and Expression, gather information of potential interest to a segment of the public, turns that information into distinct works (including through its news website, located at https://thefire.org/news), and distributes that information to the public. The information requested here relates to information that is about current events or that would be of current interest to the public. The requestor's past publication record (in addition to FIRE's articles available at https://thefire.org/news) is available at https://www.thefire.org/news-archive?author=303.

4. The requested information is not primarily in the commercial interest of the requester. The requestor works for a nonprofit organization and the records are not sought for a commercial purpose.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

title: Drug Free Zone Sentence Enhancements: Alabama Department of Corrections, Alabama

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:
Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:
A copy of all records related to persons serving or who have served a sentence for a state drug free zone law violation – under Code of Ala. 13A-12-250. Specifically, I am requesting a list of all people currently or formerly incarcerated for a drug-free zone violation from 2015 to the date that this request is processed. The list should include names, date of conviction, date of end of sentence, offenses convicted of, inmate ID, facility type (ie. state prison, local jail) and parole eligibility date.I would also like to request any demographic information that may be readily available for the above persons, such as, but not limited to, each person’s date of birth, age at arrest, current age, race, ethnicity and gender. If this time frame is overly burdensome, please provide a date range that can be fulfilled.
In addition, I am requesting a copy of any and all reports or studies generated by the state that discuss the passage and efficacy of the drug free zone law.
If there are any fees for obtaining or copying these records, please inform me should the cost exceed $100. However, I would also like to request a waiver of all fees as I am requesting the information on behalf of a 501(c)(3) nonprofit and the disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest and will contribute significantly to the public’s understanding of drug free zone laws. This information is not being sought for commercial purposes.
If possible, please provide the requested documents electronically in Excel format. However, if this is not feasible, please inform me of the available methods for obtaining these records. Further, if you expect a significant delay in responding to this request, please contact me with information concerning when I might expect copies or the ability to inspect the requested records.
If you deny any or all of this request, please cite each specific exemption that justifies the refusal to release the information and notify me of the appeal procedures available to me under the law.
Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter.
Jenny Wadhwa

title: Dr Sean C. Smith, Director of CNMS (2011-2013) complaints etc.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Dr Sean C. Smith, Director of CNMS (2011-2013) complaints etc.
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Complaints, disciplinary actions, internal investigations, or related correspondence regarding Dr Sean C. Smith, who served as the Director of the Center for Nanophase Materials Sciences at Oak Ridge National Laboratory from 2011 until 2013.

I recognize that some portions of the records may be protected under FOIA Exemption 6 (personal privacy). In assessing the public interest in disclosure, I request the following recent reporting in "The Australian" newspaper regarding allegations of Dr Smith's misconduct, and possible corrupt conduct be taken into account:
1. "Deep staff turmoil emerges amid Sean Smith v ANU Federal Court case" (Apr. 30, 2025) which details a letter from the Australian NTEU raising serious allegations of self dealing, bullying, harassment,  discrimination, and high staff turnover under Dr Smith's leadership.
2. "ANU faces bullying, negligence allegations" (Apr. 25, 2025), which reports that Professor Smith filed a Federal Court claim after the Australian National University terminated him for "loss of confidence in leadership"

I also request, however, that any reasonably segregable, non-exempt information be released. If DOE or ORNL intends to withhold any responsive material, please provide an index of the withheld documents as required by Vaughn v. Rosen.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sam Smith

communications.subject: FOI Records Request :: R000046-050125
communications.communication:
Dear Ileana Garnand: 
This message is an acknowledgement that the Connecticut State Department of Education received your Freedom of Information Act request on 5/1/2025. It was given the reference number R000046-050125 for tracking purposes. 
 
 
This letter does not constitute a denial of your request. Rather, in accordance with the Freedom of Information Act, we are in the process of researching and gathering documentation which may be responsive to it. Once the documents are gathered, we will then conduct a review to determine if statutory exemptions to disclosure may apply to some or all of the documents. Upon completion of that review, we will be able to provide you with any responsive, non-exempt documents. 
 
Please note the department reserves the right to charge any such other fees as may be appropriate pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act. 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. Again, thank you for using the FOI Records Center. 
Connecticut State Department of Education

communications.subject: RE: Indiana Access to Public Records Act Request: Indiana SEA response
communications.communication:
Good afternoon Ileana,

Thank you for contacting the Indiana Department of Education (“IDOE”). Beginning in December 2023, all legitimate public records/APRA requests seeking a tangible, existing document must be submitted via the Indiana Department of Education’s APRA Portal<https://in.accessgov.com/doe-apra>. Requests submitted via email or standard mail will not be accepted. Please submit your request via the Indiana Department of Education’s APRA Portal<https://in.accessgov.com/doe-apra>.

Thank you,

- Billy

William H. Ottensmeyer
Staff Attorney
Office of Legal Affairs
Indiana Department of Education
www.doe.in.gov<http://www.doe.in.gov/>

CONFIDENTIALITY NOTICE:
A lawyer has sent this communication.  It may contain information that is confidential, privileged, proprietary, or otherwise legally exempt from disclosure.  If you are not the original and intended recipient, you may not read, print, retain, copy or disseminate this message or its attachments, in whole or in part.  If you have received this message in error, please delete this message and its attachments from your system without reading the content, and notify the sender immediately of your receipt of it.  The sender does not intend to waive, in any respect, any of the applicable privileges that may attach to this communication, including, but not limited to, the attorney-client privilege.  Thank you for your cooperation.

communications.subject: Maryland Public Information Act Requests Online Re: Maryland Public Information Act Request: Maryland SEA response
communications.communication:
Thank you for contacting
the Maryland State Department of Education (MSDE). Please note that as of
March 25, 2025, all Maryland Public Information Act requests for MSDE records must
now be submitted online through the portal. (https://marylandpublicschools.govqa.us/WEBAPP/_rs/(S(watzz1mse3tukjdpq0z5avus))/supporthome.aspx) MSDE Public Records Center 
Please refrain from
submitting formal Maryland Public Information Act requests via email.
 T o get
started, visit the MSDE Public Records Center portal. Create
a login or login with your existing credentials Submit your Public
Information Act request Keep your tracking number in
a secure place for your records Messages can be
sent/received through the portal All other correspondences sent to this email address will
be reviewed within three business days. 
  Thank you. 

-- 
Michelle Berry Public Information Act Manager 
Office of Communications and Community Engagement 
pia.msde@maryland.gov (mailto:pia.msde@maryland.gov) 
200 W. Baltimore Street

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Massachusetts SEA response
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

All documentation submitted to the U.S. Department of Education's Student Privacy Policy Office in response to the office's March 28, 2025, request for records such as "'reports, information on policies and procedures, annual notifications, training materials or other information necessary' to provide assurance that the SEA and their respective LEAs are complying with the provisions of FERPA and PPRA".

I have attached a copy of the SPPO's request letter for reference. The relevant section is found on the last page, under "Assurance of Compliance". The SPPO requested the documentation be submitted no later than April 30, 2025. If the Massachusetts Department of Education sent communications to the SPPO requesting an extension or declining to submit the documentation, I request a copy of said communications.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ileana Garnand
